thread.title: Picture this: New Polaroid camera prints pictures instantly WITHOUT ink
thread.title_full: Picture this: New Polaroid camera prints pictures instantly WITHOUT ink - Mirror Online

author: Jeff Parsons
title: Picture this: New Polaroid camera prints pictures instantly WITHOUT ink
text:
Those with fond memories of waving Polaroid snaps in the air to help them develop will be amazed at the company's latest camera.
Called the Polaroid Snap , it will let you print out pictures instantly without having to worry about replacing ink.
Instead, it uses a special type of printing paper developed by a company called ZINK. It features cyan, yellow and magenta dye crystals under a polymer coating that are activated by the camera when you hit the shutter.
Like the Polaroids of old, the Snap will print out square photos that are 2x3-inches.
And even if you don't want a proper picture, you can use the built-in microSD card slot to s tore the pictures digitally .
Unfortunately, because of the tech involved you'll have to fork out for special packs of the ZINK paper. A pack of 50 currently costs $25 (£16.30) - although the fact they have adhesive backs mean you can use them as stickers.
The camera itself will be on sale later in 2015 with a US price of $99 (£64).
